title: How to type special characters in German - Quora

response.answer_text: There are several ways but they depend on your computer operating system, Apple or Windows. I have an Apple Mac, and to create an umlaut (¨), I hold down the ‘”option” key on the lower left and click (“u”). Then I type the letter that needs the umlaut (ä). Do a quick internet search for your operating system and you’ll get a list of alphabet “work-arounds.” Sometimes it’s possible to get a German keyboard, but I think that typically means buying a computer in a German speaking country. And finally, there may be a “switch” to change your keyboard to actually type with a German keyboard layout, but you would have to remember what changes and what doesn't. For example, you may still have an English-looking keyboard but if you type “y” it will come out “z.”

On a keyboard or phone/tablet? Phone/tablet is easy, just keep pressing the letter you want an umlaut over and slide your finger to the wanted letter and release, same for the “double s” s=ß. On a keyboard for iPad: HOLD option and press “u” (option + u) then the letter you want the umlaut above. Double s: HOLD “option” and press “s” (option + s) = ß. On a Mac it depends on which language your keyboard is set up with, but it’s fairly easy with an American keyboard, HOLD “option” as you press “u” (option + u), then enter a/o/u. For the double s: HOLD “option” and press “s” (option + s) = ß. For PC it’s a little more tricky, but the unquestionably easiest thing to do is to set your keyboard to “US International” in the settings menu under the Windows icon in the toolbar and: press “ then the letter you want an umlaut over. For a double s: HOLD RightAlt and press “s” (RightAlt + s) = ß. Hope that helped:)
